body:
Thanks for this thorough description @juliusz-cwiakalski!

Would you be willing to contribute a fix?

Hi @geoand 
I'm happy to provide the fix. Just need to go through the contributor manual + figure out how to efficiently test this part as seems it's not really tested yet in the unit tests. 

Will ping you once PR is ready (hopefully tomorrow?)

issue.title: Correctly handle multiple Set-Cookie headers for API Gateway v2
issue.body:
Multiple Set-Cookie headers were merged into a single header when running Quarkus as an AWS Lambda behind API Gateway v2. The cause was a case-sensitive check for "set-cookie" in LambdaHttpHandler, while Vert.x HeadersMultiMap normalizes names (e.g., "Set-Cookie") and is case-insensitive. As a result, cookie values were treated as regular headers and comma-joined, breaking multiple-cookie scenarios.

Change the comparison to equalsIgnoreCase and route Set-Cookie values to the API Gateway v2 cookies array, preserving each cookie as a separate entry and omitting headers.'Set-Cookie' in the Lambda response.

Also add tests and a small resource to verify behavior:
- CookiesResource to emit one or two cookies via JAX-RS.
- AmazonLambdaSimpleTestCase:
  - testSingleCookieByEvent and testMultipleCookiesByEvent assert cookies[] is populated and headers.'Set-Cookie' is absent for API Gateway v2 events.
  - testMultipleCookiesDirectHttp asserts direct HTTP responses still return multiple Set-Cookie headers.

References:
- API Gateway v2 Lambda payload: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/http-api-develop-integrations-lambda.html

- Fixes: #50075

body:
> No rush, thanks a lot!

Hey @geoand - I'm in a rush cause it's blocking my auth service I need for https://app.menuvivo.com ðŸ™ƒ 
anyway fix and tests are here https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/50137 - seems that cookie part was not tested at all so I covered it to prevent regression in the future.

Just curious - what is the release cycle? when can I expect to get this fix into a release? 
Shall I create also a PR against latest release branch too (or earlier branches as well?) 
Sorry for my dummy questions but this is my first contribution to Quarkus  so please be patient with me ;) Thx!

Thanks a lot!

You can see our release planning [here](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/wiki/Release-Planning). Assuming everything goes well and the PR is merged, the most likely outcome is that this gets into `3.28.z` and also gets backported to `3.27.z` at some point
